content: **note ** please place a unique beginning of the round marker before you place your other stitch markers raglan measurements small 25 5 waist medium 31 waist large 36 waist here s more detailed measurements about the sizes these measurements were taken while the raglan was laying flat wide will be half the circumference small= approx 32 5cm wide 12 75 59cm long 23 25 medium=39cm wide 15 25 59cm long 23 25 large= approx 45 5cm wide 18 59cm long 23 25 ------**-note for size upgrades 12sts adds 2 5 inches** gauge ribbing on size 8 us 7 sts=1 vertically stockinette on size 9 us 6 sts=1 vertically 5 sts=1 horizontally new this pattern is translated into french & spanish please note that in the original pattern it has an almost 1/2 arm-long sleeve and has thick stripes running along the sweater but like in the many projects that has been done there is so many different things you can do to this sweater to make it unique this boatneck is a little loose for a tighter boat-neck go down on the needle size for the ribbing acrylic yarn is great for the bank but if you want a sweater that will really last choose a soft wool it s not as washable you ll always have to be careful not to felt it but it will hold it s shape the most please please take note that in the pattern it specifically asks you to try on the raglan when you are doing the yoke and as you go along everyone s body is different and you can make it fit like a glove on you if you try it on and judge whether or not you need more increases/decreases in the designated spots this pattern doesn t have a main pattern it s just stockinette stitch so you won t really have to be too concerned about how many stitches you have or need just as long as it fits you right and you are doing increases/decreases equally around the stitch markers you don t want a lopsided garment ex if you have a big bust but normal-sized arms do less arm increases but keep on doing increases in the front of the sweater
